intro: Diplostephium phlogotrichum, commonly known as the fire-spore grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers, which are pollinated by wind. It is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
